page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF AREA 1
page.content: ECOLOGY. This is a rural area dominated by the mountain peaks of the Clwydian range, Moel Arthur, Moel Llys-y-coed, and Moel Dywyll, in whose foothills nestle the tiny villages of Rhiwbebyll, Groes fawr, Llangynhafal, and Hendrerwydd. The area has recently been designated as one of outstanding natural beauty and is subject to the laws of conservation. The landscape is varied, there is limited access to the higher ground by narrow roads, but the Moels are only accessable by footpath. There are many streams flowing from the higher ground to feed to the west, the river Clwyd (Afon Clywd), and to the east, these streams have been dammed by the Welsh water authority to provide water for the Mold area.
